business.headline: IndiGo to cut ties with Turkish Airlines amid row over Turkey's support to PakThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation said IndiGo gave an undertaking that it will terminate the lease with Turkish Airlines by August 31 and will not seek a further extension.

ITR-1 and ITR-4 Excel utilities out: Check who can file and what's new this yearExcel utilities for ITR-1 and ITR-4 are now available for AY 2025–26. Taxpayers can visit the income tax e-filing site to download and use them for filing returns for FY 2024–25.
Gensol misses May payment for loan on BluSmart cabs: ReportGensol Engineering reportedly missed a payment of about Rs 4 crore to its pass-through certificate (PTC) holders in May.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.
Sensex closes 182 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; IT stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 182 points to end at 81,451.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 82.90 points to close at 24,750.70.

From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

Arshad Warsi, his wife, among 59 people banned from stock market for 1 yearSebi said the group was part of a scheme to artificially raise the price of Sadhna Broadcast shares before selling them to unsuspecting retail investors.

Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

Ola Electric shares nosedive 10% after Q4 net loss. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ola Electric's Q4 numbers have laid bare the challenges facing India's EV poster child, from falling volumes and margin pressures to delays in execution. While the company's aggressive bets on electric motorcycles and rural expansion could pay off, the near-term outlook is murky.

Mazagon Dock shares snap winning streak, tumble 8%. Here's whyThe stock fell to an intraday low of Rs 3,450, retracing from Thursday's close of Rs 3,749. Around 10:07 am, shares of the company were trading 4.75% lower at Rs 3,574.40.

Suzlon Energy share price up 13% over strong Q4 results: Should you buy?Suzlon Energy stock price: The shares jumped as much as 13% in early trade, reaching an intraday high of Rs 74.30 on the BSE. This rise comes after Suzlon Energy Ltd announced a sharp rise in its quarterly profit.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy shares rose 13% after Q4 resultsThe sharp rally came after Suzlon posted a 365% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit for Q4FY25. Profit rose to Rs 1,182 crore from Rs 254 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased 73% to Rs 3,773 crore, compared to Rs 2,179 crore in the year-ago period.
Sensex opens 150 points lower; Nifty below 24,800; Infosys down over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 45.58 points to 81,587.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 24.20 points to 24,857.80 as of 9:25 am.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusProstarm Info Systems was subscribed to nearly 100 times. The IPO opened for subscription on May 27, 2025, and closed on May 29, 2025.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher today. Here's whyAt 8:14 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,950, suggesting a positive start above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,833.6. This indicates that markets may open with gains in early trade.

Stocks to watch on May 30: LIC, Baja Auto, Ola, Nykaa, Mazagaon Dock, IndiGoAs the week nears its end, investors will be looking out for key movements on Friday, May 30, especially as several companies are expected to release their quarterly earnings.
Elf beauty buys Hailey Bieber's Rhode in $1 billion dealElf will acquire Rhode for $600 million in cash and $200 million of newly issued shares of Elf Beauty common stock.

Mumbai's Dharavi to get a Rs 95,790 crore makeover in 7 yearsThe redevelopment is being led by a special purpose vehicle (SPV), Navbharat Mega Developers Private Limited (NMDPL), formed through a joint venture between the Maharashtra government's Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) and the Adani Group's Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited (DRPPL).

Mumbai's record home deal: USV's chairperson picks up duplexes for Rs 639 croreThese sea-facing homes are in the high-end 40-storey Naman Xana building on Worli Sea Face, offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea. The duplexes are spread across four floors – from the 32nd to the 35th, covering a total area of 22,572 sq ft.
Sensex ends 321 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; IndusInd Bank up over 2%The BSE Sensex ended 320.70 points higher at 81,633.02, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 81.15 points higher at 24,833.60.

From PF access to free Aadhaar update: 5 key financial changes in June 2025The deadline to update your Aadhaar details online for free is June 14, 2025. Those who fail to update their identity and address proof documents by this date will incur a fee of Rs 25 for updates through the online portal or Rs 50 at physical Aadhaar centres.

ITR-1 or ITR-2: Know which form suits your 2025-26 tax filingAn informative guide on choosing between ITR-1 and ITR-2 for salaried individuals, highlighting the eligibility criteria and recent updates.

ITR deadline extended for many, but not all. Are you among the exceptions?While most taxpayers have extra time to file their returns, not everyone's in the safe zone. If audit rules apply to you, your deadline hasn't moved. Does your name fall on the exception list? Let's find out here.

New pension rules for PSU employees: Key things to knowUnder the newly notified Central Civil Services (Pension) Amendment Rules, 2025, any PSU employee dismissed or removed after absorption due to misconduct could forfeit their PSU-related benefits and pension entitlements earned during their earlier government service.
Radico Khaitan withdraws brand name of new single-malt whisky after objectionsRadico Khaitan emphasised that the decision was not merely commercial but a mark of respect for public sentiment.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares are in focus todayIndusInd Bank shares were trading 0.62% higher at Rs 809.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 9:42 am.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US court blocks Trump's tariffs, IT stocks rallyThe BSE Sensex was trading 424.23 points higher at 81,736.55 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 89.80 points to trade at 24,842.25. Most of the broader market indices also rose, reflecting the positive sentiments on Dalal Street.

Delhi startup founder says salary stagnation is breaking India's middle classThe startup founder has criticised India's economic policies for overlooking the salaried middle class, who contribute heavily to tax collections and consumer demand but receive little in return.
Stock Market Today: Sensex, Nifty set for positive opening todayGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,836 as of 8:58 am, indicating a firm start for the Nifty 50, which ended Wednesday at 24,752.45.

Stocks to watch today: IndusInd Bank, IRCTC, Adani Ports, Suzlon in focusKeep an eye on IndusInd Bank, Adani Ports, SAIL, IRCTC, and Cummins India today, as earnings, regulatory action, and fundraising updates drive sentiment in the final stretch of May.

India, US may agree on interim trade deal by June 25: SourcesAn interim trade pact between India and the US may be agreed upon by June 25, according to sources. A team of US officials is expected to visit India next month for trade talks.

Filing ITR late? You can earn 33% more interest on tax refunds this yearIf you've paid extra tax via TDS, advance tax, or self-assessment, you're entitled to a refund. As per Section 244A of the Income Tax Act, the department pays 0.5% monthly interest on the excess.
Want to get debt-free sooner? 5 simple ways to pay off your loan fasterPersonal loans help manage big expenses, but repaying them quickly saves on interest and boosts your credit score.

MSP boost for farmers as Cabinet clears new rates for Kharif season 2025-26The MSP is the minimum price at which the government promises to buy crops from farmers, even if the market prices are lower. It is set every year for various crops to make sure farmers get a fair price.

Sensex ends 240 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; ITC falls 3%The BSE Sensex ended 239.31 points lower at 81,312.32, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.75 points to settle at 24,752.45. Most of the broader market indices also fell due to high volatility.

entertainment.headline: Shabana and I've been sleeping on streets: Javed Akhtar reacts to Pak actor's remarkJaved Akhtar replied strongly to Pakistani actor Bushra Ansari's comments about him not getting a house to rent. He said she has no right to tell him to stay quiet and proudly said he is Indian.

Radhika Apte hopes Sister Midnight releases uncut in IndiaActor Radhika Apte discusses her daring new film Sister Midnight and its journey to an Indian release, hoping it will be shown uncut despite censorship concerns.

Saif Ali Khan shares his success mantra: Saying no to work, yes to familySaif Ali Khan shared that true success, for him, means choosing family time over work commitments. He said small moments with loved one's matter more than professional achievements.

Disha Patani to make Hollywood debut with Kevin Spacey's HoliguardsActor Disha Patani is set to make her Hollywood debut with Kevin Spacey's upcoming film 'Holiguards'. The film is extensively shot in Mexico.

South Indian Artistes Association backs Kamal Haasan amid language rowThe South Indian Artistes Association has strongly supported Kamal Haasan amid the recent backlash in Karnataka. The statement warns that misrepresenting Kamal could harm cinema's cultural unity and public discourse.

Thug Life and Vishwaroopam: Tale of two bans and Kamal Haasan's defianceKamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', directed by Mani Ratnam, has been banned in Karnataka. Twelve years ago, another film of the actor, 'Vishwaroopam', was also banned. Both times, Haasan remained unfazed.

Gigi and Bella Hadid introduce their 23-year-old half sister, Aydan NixSupermodel sisters, Gigi Hadid and Bella Hadid, have introduced their 23-year-old half-sister, Aydan Nix, who they connected with in 2023 after a surprise DNA test. Raised in Florida, Aydan is now pursuing a career in fashion after graduating from Parsons School of Design.

Criminal Justice 4 review: Stellar Pankaj Tripathi cross-examines average legal dramaReleased-Fri May 30, 2025In 'Criminal Justice Season 4', actor Pankaj Tripathi tries to hold the court in a murder case, but how much can he do alone? The story looks engaging in parts, but not fully convincing.

Mahesh Babu fan enters theatre with snake during Khaleja re-releaseA Mahesh Babu fan carried a live snake to theatres in Vijayawada as the actor's film 'Khaleja' re-released in theatres. A video of the incident has gone viral.

Hybe chairman investigated for alleged fraud before BTS comebackHybe chairman Bang Si-hyuk is under investigation for alleged fraudulent trading during the company's pre-IPO phase. The probe intensifies scrutiny as BTS prepares for its highly anticipated comeback.

Bhairavam review: A typical but good old-school Telugu commercial entertainerReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Bhairavam movie review: This Telugu family drama directed by Vijay Kanakamedala stars Manoj Manchu, Bellamkonda Sai Srinivas and Nara Rohith in the lead. The film packs a good emotional punch despite the template story, says our review.

Kankhajura review: Mohit-Roshan's thriller grips early but falters in climaxReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Kankhajura series review: 'Kankhajura' is a psychological thriller on SonyLiv that explores family tension and emotional manipulation. Despite strong performances, the series falters with a rushed and less impactful ending.

Alia Bhatt is a gorgeous bridesmaid in black for friend's white wedding in SpainActor Alia Bhatt radiated charm in a black outfit at her friend's white wedding in Spain. The pictures of her with the other bridesmaids have gone viral.

Actor Suriya to do Singam 4 next? Jyotika's now-deleted photo sparks rumoursJyotika shared a photo of Suriya in what appears to resemble his 'Singam' look from her daughter's graduation day. However, she quickly deleted the photo. Now, it has fuelled speculation about the actor's possible collaboration with director Hari for 'Singam 4.

Aishwarya Rai Bachchan gives off boss-lady vibes in new photos from Cannes 2025Aishwarya Rai Bachchan stunned in new photos from Cannes 2025. She gave powerful boss-lady vibes in a chic mauve pantsuit.

The Traitors trailer: KJo brings 20 contestants to compete in a high-voltage gameKaran Johar is set to host a new reality show 'The Traitors', premiering on Prime Video on June 12. Featuring 20 celebrities, the trailer promises intense drama, mind games, and thrilling twists.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life banned in Karnataka amid Kannada language rowActor Kamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', has been banned by the Karnataka Film Chamber. This move came after the actor's 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' comment at the film's audio launch in Chennai on May 24.

Raj Kundra jokes about using nepo-husband card on The Traitors. WatchAt the trailer launch of The Traitors, Raj Kundra reflected on how public perception of his masked appearances might play to his advantage on the reality show. "Whenever I've worn a mask, people have wondered what I'm hiding. That mystery might help me in this game," he said. Calling The Traitors a show of deception and strategy, Kundra added with a laugh that he might even use the "nepo husband" card, since the show is hosted by his brother-in-law, Karan Kundrra.

Actor Surveen Chawla breaks silence on facing casting couch after marriageActor Surveen Chawla has opened up about facing casting couch experiences and inappropriate behaviour in the film industry, even after marriage. Despite these challenges, she continues to focus on her work and is set to appear in 'Rana Naidu' Season 2.

general news.headline: So much for being Mr Nice Guy: Trump slams China for 'violating' trade deal with USTrump claimed that by sealing a trade deal with Beijing in order to save China from what was going to be a very bad situation after he imposed unprecedented 145 per cent tariffs on imports from Asia's largest economy.

Pakistan will never accept India's hegemony: Army chief MunirPakistan Army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir said Islamabad would never accept Indian dominance in the South Asian region and termed the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty a "red line" for Pakistan. Munir also accused India of backing Baloch rebels.

Colombia surprised Tharoor. Does its pro-Pak stance have China link?Colombia has expressed condolences over the loss of lives (read terrorists) in Pakistan after India's Operation Sindoor. It left Shashi Tharoor, who visited the country for global outreach, disappointed. Is there a China link to Colombia's pro-Pakistan stance?

Operation Sindoor: When Indian missiles rained on Pak terror paradeIn the concluding part of our 'A Brief History of Terrorism in Kashmir' series, we revisit India's bold strikes on Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror attack.

Kamal Haasan defiant amid Kannada row: Will only apologise if I am wrongVeteran actor Kamal Haasan refused to apologise for his remark that "Kannada was born out of Tamil," stressing that he would only do so if he was wrong.

Not just water, money too flowed from India to Pakistan as part of Indus treatyFor a treaty hailed globally as a triumph of water diplomacy, India paid not just in rivers, but in rupees, following the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) with Pakistan of 1960. Behind the Indus treaty lies the lesser-known story of how India bankrolled Pakistan's water infrastructure, only to be repaid with hostility.

PM Modi meets Vaibhav Suryavanshi after record-breaking IPL runIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Vaibhav Suryavanshi and his family after the 14-year-old batter had an incredible campaign for Rajasthan Royals in the Indian Premier League 2025.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Kerala contractor catches worker falling from first floor, CCTV captures actCCTV footage from a construction site in Kollam, Kerala, shows a contractor catching a worker who fell from the first floor. The worker was unharmed and the contractor sustained only a minor muscle strain.

Deportation fears, rejections: How Indian students can stay ahead amid US visa jittersStudents are advised to maintain vigilance, academic discipline, a clean digital footprint, and a well-thought-out Plan B that includes Europe and the United Kingdom.

Rajasthan twins score identical 97.17% in Class 10 board resultIn what can only be described as an extraordinary coincidence, twin sisters Kanishka and Kartika Chaudhary, who've shared not just a birthday but also books, dreams, and late-night study sessions, have now added another identical milestone to their journey—scoring exactly 97.17% each in Rajasthan's Class 10 board exams.

Bomb threat to Nayab Singh Saini's office triggers security alert in ChandigarhChandigarh police are on alert after receiving a call threatening a bomb at Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini's office.

Get rich fast or die trying: India's choice is a no-brainerFor India that aspires to be powerful, it has to become filthy rich. Money can't buy you love, but it can buy aircraft carriers and friends. For the money, India needs reforms, and PM Modi will have to channel his inner Manmohan Singh, and not the inner Nehru.

Hindu Kush Himalaya could lose 75% of glaciers, billions at riskThis stark projection shows the region's vulnerability and the far-reaching consequences for water security across Asia.

Gave enemy sleepless nights: PM's Op Sindoor shoutout to BrahMosPM Modi spoke about India's growing defence manufacturing power, especially in Uttar Pradesh. He said the BrahMos missile that gave sleepless nights to the enemy during Operation Sindoor has its new address in Uttar Pradesh.

US pause on visa interviews worries Indian students, expert says relief soonThe US has paused visa interview scheduling for international students, creating uncertainty amongst students globally, especially in India, which makes up the biggest cohort of international students in the US. However, Viral Doshi, an educational consultant, suggests that once the US's social media guidance for vetting international students is updated, it will prioritise students who need to start their academic year in August or September.

How Karnataka plans to speed up disposal of piling civil casesThe state's amendments to the Code of Civil Procedure, incorporating mediation and time-bound case management, has received presidential assent

Given choice to retreat amid Pak shelling, 7 BSF women sent enemy runningSeven BSF women defended two forward posts for three days in the Akhnoor Sector of Jammu and Kashmir amid intense shelling by Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. The all-woman team, led by Assistant Commandant Neha Bhandari, were offered the option to withdraw, but they not only defended the posts but sent Pakistani soldiers fleeing for their lives.

Rajnath Singh praises Navy's role during Op Sindoor: Pak ships didn't dare...Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited INS Vikrant in the Arabian Sea weeks after its lead role in Operation Sindoor, which pressured Pakistan into a ceasefire.

sports.headline: Rohit rides his luck to fifty day after Kohli fails in IPL playoffsIPL 2025: Rohit Sharma hit a rapid 28-ball fifty in the IPL Eliminator against Gujarat Titans on Friday. Rohit, who was dropped early twice in his innings made the best of his luck in Mullanpur Stadium.

MS Dhoni back in Ranchi, enjoys fishing after CSK's disappointing IPL seasonChennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni was seen enjoying a fishing session in Ranchi after returning home following the five-time champions' early exit from the IPL 2025 season. After RCB reach final, De Villiers breaks Ee Saala Cup Namde promise to ViratAB de Villiers admitted to uttering the forbidden RCB phrase 'Ee Saala Cup Namde' despite Virat Kohli's warning. RCB reached the IPL final after nine years, raising hopes of ending the elusive wait for title.

If RCB have to win the IPL, Mumbai Indians shouldn't enter the final: R AshwinFormer India cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin feels Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) mustn't face Mumbai Indians (MI) if they're to win their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title.

We went too hard upfront, a measured approach would've been wiser: James HopesPunjab Kings (PBKS) fast bowling coach James Hopes admitted that they went too hard upfront in the Qualifier 1 game against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). Punjab got all out for just 101 in 14.1 overs as RCB went on to win the match by eight wickets.

What has changed in Shubman Gill's captaincy in IPL 2025? Sunil Gavaskar decodesSunil Gavaskar has explained what has changed with Shubman Gill's captaincy in IPL 2025. Gill has led from the front for Gujarat Titans this season as they made it to the playoffs with 9 wins out of 14 games.

Can Rohit Sharma break his playoff jinx? MI face big questions ahead of EliminatorMumbai Indians will need their hitman, Rohit Sharma, to score big as they take on Gujarat Titans in the Eliminator fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Rohit has had a mixed season so far as he has scored 329 runs from 13 innings at an average of 27.41 and a strike rate of 147.53.

India announce squad for historic mixed disability IT20 Series in EnglandThe Indian men's mixed disability team is set to face England in a seven-match IT20I series, starting June 21. Taunton, Wormsley, Worcester, Bristol and Lord's will host the matches.

IPL Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 floors AB de VilliersAB de Villiers was in awe of Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 as RCB reached the final of the IPL 2025 season. Kohli was lively on the field for RCB as they thrashed PBKS to reach the final.

Chasing 150-160 would have been tough: Josh HazlewoodIPL 2025, Qualifier 1, PBKS vs RCB: Josh Hazlewood said that the Royal Challengers Bengaluru would have struggled had Punjab Kings set a target in the range of 150 and 160 in Mullanpur. RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets on Thursday and secured their berth in the final.

Did you see that coming? RCB ditch the drama with ice-cold nerves in Qualifier 1IPL 2025: RCB turned back years of painful playoff collapses with a performance that was all poise, no panic in the Qualifier 1 win over Punjab Kings. Ice in their veins, clarity in their plans and now, just one win away from rewriting history.

Sunil Gavaskar tips 'focused and mature' RCB to win IPL after crushing PBKSLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar praised Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) for their subdued celebrations after a thumping win over Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Qualifier 1 and backed them to win the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

French Open Day 6: Swiatek, Alcaraz, Sabalenka set for Round 3French Open 2025, Day 6 Order of Play: Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and others will aim for a berth in the fourth round when they take the court on Friday, May 30. Yuki Bhambri and Rohan Bopanna will also in action.

PBKS looked in too much of a hurry, RCB fully deserve to be in final: GavaskarLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) put up an all-around show in the Qualifier 1 fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Punjab Kings. RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets to qualify for the IPL final for the fourth time in their history.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
